## How it works
Step 1
### Bootstrap straight from your web app 
Copy and paste your web app url into ToDesktop. Customise your app design, app icon and window frame UI with no code.
  * [Multiple windows](https://www.todesktop.com/</docs/tutorials/multi-window-todomvc>)
  * [Customisable menus](https://www.todesktop.com/</docs/tutorials/multi-window-todomvc>)
  * [Menubar/tray menus](https://www.todesktop.com/</docs/trays/tray-icons>)
  * [Launch on startup](https://www.todesktop.com/</docs/application/launch-at-startup>)
  * Offline support 
  * Tabs (Mac only) 


Step 2
### Add desktop code to customise your web app 
No need to create a new repository, just add code from our desktop APIs to your codebase and get access to system level functionality.
  * [Native notifications](https://www.todesktop.com/</docs/miscellaneous/sending-notifications>)
  * Global keyboard shortcuts 
  * [Application menu](https://www.todesktop.com/</docs/menus/application-menu>)
  * [Context menu](https://www.todesktop.com/</docs/API/client-core.appmenu>)
  * [Dock/Icon](https://www.todesktop.com/</docs/API/client-core.app.dock>)
  * [Isolated browser views](https://www.todesktop.com/</docs/API/client-core.views>)
  * [File system access](https://www.todesktop.com/</docs/files/file-system-plugin>)
  * […plus more APIs in our docs](https://www.todesktop.com/</docs/API/client-core.app>)


App.js
import {
dock,
isDesktopApp
} from '@todesktop/core'
if (isDesktopApp) {
dock.bounce()
dock.setBadge(3)
}

Step 3
### Publish 
One-click will publish your desktop app to your customers and give you a download link to put on your website.
  * Super-fast global CDN 
  * [Download links on your domain](https://www.todesktop.com/</docs/application/download-links-from-your-website>)
  * [Magic universal links](https://www.todesktop.com/</docs/application/download-links-from-your-website>)
  * Download analytics 
  * Manage version numbers 
  * Native installers for all platforms

**ToDesktop Overview**

**Website**: [ToDesktop](https://www.todesktop.com)

ToDesktop is a startup headquartered in Cork, Ireland, and it belongs to Y Combinator’s Batch W20. With a tiny team of just two employees, it has set out on a straightforward mission: to streamline the process of building and releasing desktop apps for developers and businesses. 

At its core, ToDesktop is an all-in-one platform designed to save developers significant time—up to several months—by automating tedious tasks like code signing, managing auto-updates, and creating native installers for Windows, Mac, and Linux. This means developers can focus on building their apps while ToDesktop handles the nitty-gritty details.

**Key Features**:
1. **Cross-Platform Support**: Developers can take their existing web app codebase and convert it into desktop applications with native functionality in a matter of minutes.
2. **No-code Solutions**: ToDesktop provides a drag-and-drop builder, making it accessible even to those without a coding background.
3. **Seamless Deployment**: Once your desktop app is ready, a single click can publish it to your users, complete with a customizable download link.

**How It Works**: 
1. **Bootstrap**: You start by inputting your web app URL into ToDesktop, which allows for customization of app design, icons, and user interface elements—all without writing code.
2. **Integration**: You can add native desktop features to your app using ToDesktop's APIs, gaining access to system-level functionality like notifications and keyboard shortcuts.
3. **Publish**: The platform simplifies the publishing process, handling everything from download analytics to version management and native installers.

**Pricing Model**: ToDesktop offers several pricing tiers:
- **Free**: For personal use or testing.
- **Essential**: $100/month for simple desktop apps, including code signing and native installers.
- **Professional**: $240/month for more sophisticated solutions, with additional features like branded download links and analytics.
- **Enterprise**: Tailored solutions with priority support and custom billing options.

ToDesktop’s clientele is growing, with showcased apps like Rise, Basedash, and LifeAt benefiting from its platform. It has gathered positive testimonials for its simplicity, efficiency, and powerful API integrations.

In essence, if you’re in the web app development game and looking to round out your offering with a desktop app, ToDesktop is a compelling option worth exploring. Whether you’re an indie developer or part of a larger company, it has the tools to expedite the transition into the desktop space, allowing you to ship products with native capabilities in no time.
